entry.title: SAP‚ÄØFiori & UI5 ‚Äì What‚Äôs New in 2025
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,
SAP Fiori and SAPUI5 continue to evolve rapidly, and 2025 brings one of the most impactful sets of enhancements in recent years.
From design system upgrades to AI-driven development and improved tooling, these innovations help teams deliver faster, smarter, and more accessible SAP applications.
Below is a curated summary of the most important updates and why they matter for designers, developers, and IT leaders.
1. Launchpad & My Home: A More Personalized Experience
SAP Fiori Launchpad continues its journey toward deeper personalization and flexibility.
What‚Äôs new
‚Ä¢ Smart cards with workflow and business object integration
‚Ä¢ Drag-and-drop layout customization
‚Ä¢ Role-based configuration options
‚Ä¢ Full dark mode and enhanced theme sets
Why it matters:
Users gain more control over their workspace, improving usability, accessibility, and overall engagement.
2. Fiori Elements & OData V4: Faster, Cleaner App Development
The OData V4‚Äìbased programming model is maturing, making it the recommended foundation for new enterprise apps.
What‚Äôs new
‚Ä¢ Mass-change tables for bulk data updates
‚Ä¢ Standard object-creation dialogs
‚Ä¢ Local annotations for flexible metadata handling
Why it matters:
Teams can build data-heavy applications with less custom code, faster extensions, and a cleaner architecture.
3. Developer Tooling: Productivity Boost Across the Board
The developer experience gets a major upgrade with new capabilities in Fiori Tools and the Adaptation Editor.
What‚Äôs new
‚Ä¢ Fiori Tools 2503 enhancements
‚Ä¢ Improved Adaptation Editor with smoother change workflows
‚Ä¢ Drag-and-drop image support for apps
Why it matters:
Developers can prototype, extend, and test apps faster ‚Äî reducing development effort and improving consistency.
4. UI5 Framework & Web Components: Modern, Modular, Open
SAPUI5 and SAP Web Components continue progressing toward a more modular and standards-aligned ecosystem.
What‚Äôs new
‚Ä¢ UI5 Linter v1.0 for cleaner, more maintainable code
‚Ä¢ Web Components v2.x with custom icon collections
‚Ä¢ Multi-Channel Protocol (MCP) server support for AI-driven workflows
Why it matters:
You get cleaner code, better consistency, and a more modern development model aligned with open-web standards.
5. AI & Joule Copilot: Intelligence Inside the UI
AI is now natively embedded across the SAP UX landscape.
What‚Äôs new
‚Ä¢ AI-enhanced filters and summarization
‚Ä¢ Natural-language generation of cards and content
‚Ä¢ New UI elements in the AI Kit:
o AI Button
o AI Prompt Input
Why it matters:
These features bring contextual intelligence directly to the user interface ‚Äî accelerating decision-making and reducing manual effort.
6. Theming, Accessibility & Horizon
The UX theme system continues to improve for better consistency and inclusion.
What‚Äôs new
‚Ä¢ Horizon is now the primary theme set for SAP Fiori
‚Ä¢ Full compliance with WCAG 2.2 accessibility guidelines
‚Ä¢ Dark mode + high-contrast theme sets adopted across apps
Why it matters:
Enterprises can deliver modern, inclusive applications that meet global accessibility standards.
7. Performance, Diagnostics & Supportability
Performance and troubleshooting receive notable improvements.
What‚Äôs new
‚Ä¢ Faster table rendering, especially for large grid tables
‚Ä¢ Improved logging of app versions and configuration metadata
‚Ä¢ Better diagnostics for support and lifecycle management
Why it matters:
Teams benefit from smoother performance and simpler support operations across environments.
8. Recommendations & Next Steps
To make the most of the 2025 updates:
‚Ä¢ Upgrade to the latest SAPUI5 and Fiori Tools releases
‚Ä¢ Migrate any custom themes to Horizon
‚Ä¢ Use OData V4 for all new apps
‚Ä¢ Validate apps in dark mode and high-contrast mode
‚Ä¢ Explore AI UI components and Joule Copilot integration
‚Ä¢ Start adopting UI5 Linter and Web Components in new projects
Conclusion
2025 marks a major step forward for SAP Fiori and UI5.
With enhanced personalization, AI-driven features, modern design, and stronger developer tooling, SAP is clearly investing in a future where enterprise applications are smarter, faster, and more intuitive.

//EnhanceLearning
Dhanasupriya Sidagam

entry.title: Everything You Need to Know About Contacting SAP Fieldglass Support
entry.content:
For SAP Fieldglass Administrators, PMOs, and Managed Service Providers

If your role is SAP Fieldglass Administrator, Program Office Manager, or Managed Service Provider (MSP), your path to support is to Get Support via both webform and Expert Chat by going to SAP for Me.

Here‚Äôs how to get started:

  • Go to https://me.sap.com/
  • Sign in with your S-User ID and password (Your user administrator can request any number of user IDs for buyer users and assign them the required authorizations.)
  • Choose the Services & Support dashboard, then click the Get Support (Case, Expert Chat‚Ä¶) for step-by-step guided Get Support application
  • As you create a case, AI recommends relevant solutions to resolve your issue in real-time or directs your request to the most suitable channel which may include Expert Chat.

Keep in mind that all technical questions will be addressed exclusively through the case you‚Äôve reported.


For Workers, Suppliers, and Buyers

If you‚Äôre using Fieldglass as a worker, supplier, or you do not have an S-User ID, the best place to start is the Fieldglass Help Center.

  • Here‚Äôs the process:
  • Go to Fieldglass Help Center
  • Choose the role best describes you
  • Select ‚ÄúContact Support‚Äù
  • Start by describing what you need help with
  • Our AI powered engine will gather resources to point you to an answer right away
  • Fill in the details as required in the page
  • Select your preferred contact option

Once your case is created, the Fieldglass Support team contact you.

Friendly reminder: Include as much information as you can when submitting your case (such as error details or steps already tested). This helps the team diagnose and solve your issue much faster.


Why Following the Right Path Helps?

By using the correct support channel for your role, your request is routed to the right team right away. This means less waiting, faster solutions, and smoother overall experience‚Äîwhether you‚Äôre a first-time user or an experienced administrator.

We hope this guide makes reaching out to SAP Fieldglass Support clearer and easier for you. If you‚Äôve already used these channels, we‚Äôd love to hear about your experience‚Äîfeel free to share your feedback.

Stay connected for more posts and for our upcoming Support Webinars and recorded sessions to
continuously learn and get the best from SAP Support: Register Now

entry.title: Re: SAC - Update Dimension Values in a Planning Model Wit...
entry.content:
Hi @Wioletta_Sokolowska-Fabisz 

There is no straight way of updating IDs in the system. 

As workaround: 

1. Keeping "old" IDs, create new IDs in Product Dim

2. For new IDs create property (mapping property) and for each new ID put "Old" ID of the product

3. Create Data Action which will copy data from "old" ID to the new one. In the same DA create step do delete data from "Old" IDs

4. Delete "Old" IDs, as now there is no data in the system. 

Here an assumption, that Product dimension is used only in one particular model. If not, then the same steps  (3-4) must be done for all models.

entry.title: How to clone a CAP based solution from one HANA Cloud Database to another?
entry.content:
Hello experts,

If you wanted to copy a CAP based solution between environments (e.g. PROD -> TEST) how would you do it?

Let's say you have a CAP based solution running productively and you want to clone that system into a test system. This solution is a stack consisting of 1+ CAP servers instances hosted in Cloud foundry and connected to a SAP HANA Cloud instance. Production and test are completely separate (Different HANA Cloud DBs).

Suppose both the production and test systems already exist and are working, they just have different data. We'd like to wipe the test system and repopulate it with data from the production system.

How do you typically do this? Specifically I'm looking for recommended procedures on how to do this please?

Options

One way that will work is using DB Explorer to export all the data for all the tables and then on the test DB import those files. The problem with this approach is it will require quite a lot of manual clicking, time and possibly slicing of data since it is not possible to export some tables in one go (as they are too large).

DB explorer also has an option for exporting catalog objects, but if I understand correctly, these exports bring data as well as all the scripts to create such objects on a target DB. If they were imported they would create a completely new schema/HDI on the target DB. If this is the case this is definitely not what we want.

Is there any other approach, please?
Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Re: SAP Outbound Delivery Postgoodsissue BOI
entry.content:
Dear @JamesG,

No in Public Cloud there is no BOI that can post goods issue (PGI) for an outbound delivery. You have to use the delivery API.

The officially supported way to post GI for an outbound delivery in Public Cloud is via the OData API API_OUTBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV (v0002) and its PostGoodsIssue operation.

SAP Note below, if you encounter an error:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3539067

More details below about api and SAP Help:

https://api.sap.com/bointerface/I_OUTBOUNDDELIVERYTP

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/588780cab2774a7ab9fffca3a7f919fe/3896ca0f93af4c86bdf951d8cf1a91b8.html

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.content:
I'm using cl_gui_textedit to display data on a scrolling screen. The problem is that the cl_gui_textedit screen doesn't scroll down; it stays fixed on the screen. How can I fix this? Code :

    CREATE OBJECT go_custom
      EXPORTING
        container_name              = 'CONTAINER'
        repid                       = sy-repid
        dynnr                       = sy-dynnr
      EXCEPTIONS
        cntl_error                  = 1
        cntl_system_error           = 2
        create_error                = 3

        lifetime_dynpro_dynpro_link = 5
        OTHERS                      = 6.

        EXPORTING
          parent                 = go_custom
          style

          error_cntl_create      = 1
          error_cntl_init        = 2
          error_cntl_link        = 3
          error_dp_create        = 4
          gui_type_not_supported = 5
          OTHERS                 = 6.

      CALL METHOD go_textedit->set_text_as_r3table

          table           = tl_string2
        EXCEPTIONS
          error_dp        = 1
          error_dp_create = 2
          OTHERS          = 3.

        EXPORTING
          readonly_mode          = 1
        EXCEPTIONS
          error_cntl_call_method = 1
          invalid_parameter      = 2
          OTHERS                 = 3.

entry.title: Need to rederive profit center in purchase order
entry.content:
• Update profit center while posting GR
  • Possibility to mass update the saved PO with the updated Profit center

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Need to rederive profit center in purchase order
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the profit center in a Purchase Order is determined at the time the PO is created. Any later changes made in the material master do not update profit centers in existing POs -this is standard system behavior.

Regarding follow-up points:

  • Updating profit center at Goods Receipt:
    This is not possible. GR always follows the account assignment of the PO, and profit center cannot be re-derived or changed during GR posting.
  • Mass-updating profit centers in existing POs:
    There is no standard functionality to mass-update profit centers in previously created POs.

You may create a new requirement request in the customer influence portal.

SAP Customer Influence enables customers to submit improvement requests and to openly vote on them.

These voting results inform SAP of product enhancements and changes customers are most interested in seeing in future releases.

1. Get started by opening SAP Customer Influence SAP Continuous Influence sessions for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition

2. Register and accept the Terms of Use

3. Choose a session of your interest

4. Create and submit your improvement request

5. Take a look at existing improvement requests and start voting and commenting

Best regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Title: API for Supplier Master and Supplier Bank Acco...
entry.content:
Dear @byd,

Yes in Public Cloud you do have standard APIs for both supplier master and supplier bank data. Everything is driven via Business Partner.

Supplier master creation and update:

The main API is: OData (recommended)

API name:
Business Partner (A2X) ‚Äì technical name API_BUSINESS_PARTNER

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/3c916ef10fc240c9afc594b346ffaf77/85043858ea0f9244e10000000a4450e5.html

https://api.sap.com/package/SAPS4HANACloud/odata

 

What it can do:

This single OData service lets you create, read, update, delete master data for:

  • Business Partner header (A_BusinessPartner)
  • Supplier core data (A_Supplier)
  • Supplier company data (A_SupplierCompany)
  • Supplier purchasing data (A_SupplierPurchasingOrg)
  • Business partner roles (A_BusinessPartnerRole)

More details below from SAP Help and SAP Community for Custom Fields:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/3c916ef10fc240c9afc594b346ffaf77/1e488b3c40ff4ed3a96be20d3850b26d.html

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/add-custom-fields-to-sap-s-4hana-business-partner-odata-api-entities/ba-p/13333784

So for a typical create or update supplier scenario you:

  1. Create / update the Business Partner header
    • POST /sap/opu/odata/sap/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER/A_BusinessPartner (create)
    • PATCH /sap/opu/odata/sap/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER/A_BusinessPartner('<BP>') (update)
  2. Assign supplier roles to that BP
    • POST .../A_BusinessPartner('<BP>')/to_BusinessPartnerRole
    • Use roles like FLVN00 (FI vendor) / FLVN01 (supplier) depending on your design.
  3. Maintain supplier-specific data
    • A_Supplier ‚Äì core supplier data
    • A_SupplierCompany ‚Äì reconciliation account, payment terms, etc. per company code
    • A_SupplierPurchasingOrg ‚Äì purchasing org data (order currency, incoterms, etc.)

For your integration use case (external system maintaining suppliers) this OData API is the standard and recommended approach in Public Cloud.

Supplier bank account maintenance:

Bank data is also covered by the same Business Partner (A2X) service there is no separate Supplier Bank API.

API_BUSINESS_PARTNER you have the entity:

  • A_BusinessPartnerBank ‚Äì BusinessPartnerBank

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/3c916ef10fc240c9afc594b346ffaf77/5d5e045826552246e10000000a441470.html

It contains fields such as:

  • Business partner
  • Bank country
  • Bank account / IBAN

Typical operations:

  • Create bank account for a supplier BP
    POST /sap/opu/odata/sap/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER/A_BusinessPartnerBank
  • Update bank account
    PATCH /sap/opu/odata/sap/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER/A_BusinessPartnerBank(BusinessPartner='<BP>',BankIdentification='<ID>')


The bank itself is separate and managed via Manage Banks Master Data app. Your supplier‚Äôs bank account record in A_BusinessPartnerBank references that bank by country and bank key / ID.

More details below:

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('F6437')/S35

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/f86dc2eb1f8b48c880a7607213104b27/0e2291626ec34988876ef0217355460d.html

How to set it up in Public Cloud:

The high-level steps:

  1. Create Communication User and System (Fiori apps: Maintain Communication Users, Communication Systems).

More details below:

https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/abap-environment-business-partner-basic-auth..html

  1. Create Communication Arrangement for SAP_COM_0008
    • This exposes Business Partner (A2X) OData as inbound service.
  2. Use the generated service URL like:
    https://<your-tenant>/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER/ in your integration.

https://api.sap.com/api/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER/resource/get_A_BusinessPartner

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Re: Reimagining Certification for the Way We Work Today
entry.content:
Hi @DianaRoesner ,

I appreciate the new approach to the certification exams, where the focus is on practical application rather than memorization. This method aligns well with real-world scenarios and is a positive step forward.

I have attempted the SAP Generative AI Developer certification exam twice under the new system-based approach, prior to its recent rework. I currently have an open case with the SAP Support team (Case ID: 5000243946), but I have not received any updates for over a week. After my first attempt, I received a ‚ÄúFailed‚Äù status in my certifications tab; however, for the second attempt, no remarks or status were provided.

While I appreciate this innovative approach, I would like to share some feedback and request timely resolution so that users‚Äô attempts are not wasted:

  1. Exam Bugs:

    • In one task, the system required saving a template with the name ‚Äúoptimal model configuration‚Äù. However, after changing the template name, the system did not allow saving.

  2. Result Transparency:

    • Currently, the exam only provides a Pass/Fail status. It would be highly beneficial to include details on which tasks were unsuccessful, so candidates can identify areas for improvement.

  3. Learning Resources:

    • The existing learning journey does not provide sufficient material to help candidates understand and correct their mistakes.

  4. Human Review Option:

    • Introducing an option for human review of the exam would be extremely helpful. Personalized feedback on why a candidate failed would allow targeted improvement for future attempts.

I hope these points are helpful in enhancing the overall experience.

entry.title: Re: SAP Mobile App IOS Version: 1.11.23 - Permission Denied
entry.content: In version 1.11.23 of the SAP Mobile App for iOS, a "Permission Denied" error usually arises from incorrect user settings in SAP Business One (B1), including mismatches in the device ID or phone number, or the user not being enabled for mobile access. To resolve this issue, select the mobile checkbox for the user in the B1 user settings, check that the phone number and device ID match in both the SAP B1 user master data and the app settings, and ensure that the correct license is allocated to the user.

entry.title: SAP BTP ABAP Environment - Release 2511
entry.content:
SAP BTP ABAP Environment - Release 2511

With the introduction of the new release 2511, this blog post presents an overview of the latest features and enhancements. The release has been available since November 15th and serves as the successor to the release 2508. Some highlights of the 2511 release include the Analytical table with RAP and SAP Fiori Elements, the ADT editor for Business Configuration Sets and the Graphical Modeler for CDS. 

The list of all new features can be found on the What's New for SAP BTP ABAP Environment page

ABAP Development Tools (ADT)

  • Using ghost text as new default for keyword completion, when you start typing a keyword, ADT now shows the best matching suggestion as ghost text at the current position within your source code by default (details)
  • Editor for E-Mail templates, it allows the creation of pre-delivered e-mail templates for rendering e-mails using said templates or for further template copies created with the SAP Fiori app Maintain E-Mail Templates in different languages (details)
  • Editor for Business Configuration Sets (details)
  • ADT Objects for SAP Application Interface Framework (details)
  • Enhancements in the Dependency Analyzer for CDS Table Functions (details)
  • Support of Graphical Call Timeline on macOS for ABAP Traces (details)
  • Logon with Versions of ADT Older than 3.46 no Longer Possible

ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP)

  • Log RAP-based change documents, this feature enables the logging of RAP-based customer-defined change documents as business events in business event logging (details)
  • RAP change operations for data records, with the introduction of the new syntax addition read entity MyEntity with changes (all fields | fields ( ... ) ) with ... result data(rdc), an application developer may now access the corresponding change operations of a data record processed within the transaction
  • RAP global side effects, they are an optional part of a RAP behavior definition that define interdependencies among BO properties that trigger a reload of the affected properties on the user interface. Global side effects are those side effects that are defined without any source properties or source entities and can be invoked by an end user with a dedicated key stroke

SAP Fiori

  • Fiori Analytical Table - Read-Only, you miss the ABAP List Viewer (ALV) in Fiori with simple analytical capabilities? The Fiori Analytical Table will be introduced to combine the transactional and light-weight analytical world. RAP needs to support further OData URL to ABAP SQL mapping with analytical capabilities. For advanced analytics with multi-dimensional analytical reporting please check the analytical clients

Business Configuration

  • Support of Business Configuration Sets with a new ADT editor (see above) and new released API to extract the business configuration data in target tenants (details)
  • Hide draft related features, all features related to draft handling can be hidden from the UI while the draft functionality remains active in the background (details)

Integration

  • Predefined custom fields, you can now add predefined custom fields to OData consumption models (details)
  • New CDS views in business event logging, the following CDS views have been released: Business Event Header Data, Business Event Payload, Business Event Data, Business Event Activity (see Business Event Header Data, Business Event Payload, Business Event Data, Business Activity)
  • RFC communication via communication targets, a new enhancement in RFC communication introduces the use of communication targets and application destinations for outbound RFC communication. This ensures more secure and efficient communication processes

Event Consumption Model

  • Button Publish Locally for EEEC authorizations, the Publish Locally button in the event consumption model allows users to generate authorizations for the EEEC within the SAP_BR_DEVELOPER role (details)

Reuse Services

  • You can now reset content to the standard units of measurement delivered by SAP using the released API CL_UOM_CONTENT_HANDLER (details)
  • You can now convert SAP codes to external codes and vice versa using class CL_CONVERSION_EXT_INT (details)

XCO Library

  • You can now create, read, update, and delete business configuration sets with the XCO API (details)
  • You can now generate static external entities
  • You can now also customize the borders of individual cells using the Excel API

Maintain Translations

  • You can now use the Maintain Translations app for custom translations of application job entities. Additionally, we've removed the limit on the total amount of texts you can add and translate in a translation project. You can now add an unlimited number of texts (details)

ABAP Test Cockpit (ATC)

  • Partner support in ATC check "Usage of APIs", when using an SAP BTP ABAP environment as the central check system, the ATC check Usage of APIs allows you to specify classic APIs of SAP partners. This enables customers to improve their custom code with regards to Clean Core compliance when using APIs of certified SAP partners
  • Approve ATC Exemptions App: Receive E-Mail notifications, you can now subscribe to receive e-mail notifications when an ATC exemption request was approved (details)

Lifecycle Management

  • Manage Software Components, Software Components configured with the role Target are now protected from changes and cannot be recorded on transports. This feature is designed to prevent inadvertent modifications to components, ensuring their integrity and stability (details)
  • Manage Software Components, you can now use the safe remote deletion feature. It is designed to ensure system integrity by preventing the accidental deletion of active repositories or branches and prevents the creation of ghost software components (details)

Technical Monitoring

  • Capturing of PlanViz (PLV) files now possible in the Capture Request Statistics app, and subsequent download in the SQL Statement Analysis app (details)

entry.title: Common configuration issues: Joule for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Let's look at the common issues that we may have while setting up Joule with SuccessFactors:

  1. SAP BTP Booster | Entitlements Missing
  2. SAP BTP Booster | Sync between Joule and SAP Cloud Identity Services System failed
  3. SAP BTP Booster | No Registered Systems of type S/4HANA
  4. Joule in S/4HANA Cloud | Joule icon missing in S/4HANA Cloud
  5. Joule in S/4HANA Cloud | Some Prompts are Not Working
  6. Joule in S/4HANA Cloud |  Not Authorised

==================================================================================

So let us take a look at the issue and how to fix them:

1. SAP BTP Booster | Entitlements Missing

While running the booster, we got the error message:

‚ÄúSome of the entitlements are not available in the selected subaccount <XXXX>. Please either add them or select a subaccount with different provider or region.‚Äù

Fix: 

Go to BTP Global Account -> Entity Assignments.

Check if Joule and SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition service are entitled to the subaccount.

If Joule is not available in BTP Global Account -> Procure Joule

 

2. SAP BTP Booster | Sync between Joule and SAP Cloud Identity Services System failed

While running the Joule booster, we got the error message:

 

Fix: Please follow the KBA to setup accordingly: 

3539985 - Synchronization failed between Joule and SAP Cloud Identity Services when using booster for Joule setup

 

3. SAP BTP Booster | No Registered Systems of type S/4HANA

While running the booster, we got the error message:

Cause: S/4HANA system is not registered with BTP global account.

Fix: Double check the steps ‚ÄúRegister SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition in BTP Global Account‚Äù in the mission.

 

4. Joule in S/4HANA Cloud | Joule icon missing in S/4HANA Cloud

There are several reasons might cause this issue, please follow below to check:

4.1 Double check the step ‚ÄúUpdate Content Security Policy Settings in S/4HANA Cloud‚Äù in mission

Follow the last step to paste the URL of your Joule application into the Trusted Content text box and click Save.

4. 2  Try opening the system in an Incognito window to rule out browser cache issues.
If Joule appears there, clear your browser cache and cookies before accessing it again in normal mode.

4.3 When logging int S/4HANA Public Cloud, check the domain of Cloud Identity Services that is used during login (e.g. ending with ondemand.com or cloud.sap) => in BTP Cockpit -> Joule Subaccount -> Trust Configuration -> Select the Cloud Identity Services used for application logon -> check if the ‚ÄúDomain‚Äù is set to the same domain used in S4.

4.4 Check in Cloud Identity Services if the hosting application (S/4Public Cloud) and Joule application are configured in exact same way (IDP/Conditional authentication)

 

5. Joule in S/4HANA Cloud | Some Prompts are Not Working

5.1 Cause: CDM content not synchronised

Fix: In the Channel Manager of Build Workzone, please click on "Report" to check how many apps / roles were actually synchronised.

5. 2 Cause: User lacking role assignments.

Fix:  Check whether the logged in user actually have the required groups assigned.

Check the sample prompts and corresponding roles here.

5. 3 Double check below steps in the mission

  • Provision Users and Groups from S/4HANA Cloud to Work Zone
  • Update Content Security Policy Settings in S/4HANA Cloud

6. Joule in S/4HANA Cloud |  Not Authorised

Cause: In rare cases the automated integration between Joule and S/4HANA might fail.

Fix: Check if the CN name used in Destination S4HANA_PUB_SSO fits to the CN name maintained in S/4HANA.
In case of mismatch open an incident with CA-JOULE

CN name in above screenshot need to match between BTP Destination and S/4 Communication System (Signing Certificate Issuer in below screenshot).

 

If the issue still persists or any other issues not listed here, open a ticket under component CA-JOULE.

 

Cheers, 

Happy Learning

SAP Business AI RIG team

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025: Planificaci√≥n Financiera Consolidada y Procesamiento de Facturas
entry.content:
El SAP Inside Track Paraguay SITCDE2025 nos trajo una presentaci√≥n reveladora de la mano de Juan Jos√© Torres, quien comparti√≥ soluciones concretas para dos desaf√≠os cr√≠ticos que enfrentan las empresas con SAP: la automatizaci√≥n del procesamiento de facturas electr√≥nicas y la contabilidad orientada a unidades de negocio.


El Desaf√≠o de la Facturaci√≥n Electr√≥nica: Volumen Creciente, Tiempo Limitado
Juan Jos√© comenz√≥ con una realidad contundente: los vol√∫menes de facturaci√≥n electr√≥nica est√°n creciendo mes a mes en Paraguay, y la DNIT reporta cifras cada vez m√°s altas de documentos electr√≥nicos aprobados. Esto genera un desaf√≠o operativo significativo para las empresas.
"En pa√≠ses como Chile, si una factura emitida no fue rechazada a las 72 horas, ya empiezan a correr los tiempos de mora. Ac√° todav√≠a no est√° aplicado, pero en cualquier momento se viene."
El problema m√°s com√∫n: contabilidad centraliza las cargas de facturas, muchas veces las deja para los √∫ltimos d√≠as del mes, no se toma el cr√©dito fiscal a tiempo, y se generan problemas para el cierre contable. La soluci√≥n es clara: automatizaci√≥n.

La Soluci√≥n: Automatizaci√≥n Inteligente de Facturas
La propuesta presentada trabaja sobre cualquier versi√≥n de SAP y se basa en tres componentes clave:
Lectura Automatizada

  • Un robot lee los emails con facturas electr√≥nicas
  • Una aplicaci√≥n procesa el QR de la factura paraguaya (trabaja con XML, no con OCR)
  • Se ingresa a SAP a trav√©s de IDOC

Validaciones Inteligentes La soluci√≥n no solo carga facturas, sino que valida:

  • Mapeo autom√°tico del RUC del emisor al c√≥digo de proveedor en SAP
  • Concordancia con √≥rdenes de compra abiertas
  • Lectura del cuerpo del mail para identificar el n√∫mero de orden de compra
  • Determinaci√≥n del centro de costos basado en sucursales
  • Validaci√≥n de condiciones de pago e indicadores de impuestos

Rechazo Autom√°tico Inteligente
Si la factura no cumple con las reglas de negocio (por ejemplo, no declara una orden de compra v√°lida), el sistema la rechaza autom√°ticamente con el listado de √≥rdenes de compra disponibles para que el proveedor reenv√≠e el mail. Esto evita el trabajo manual de an√°lisis y respuesta.
Beneficios Concretos La implementaci√≥n de esta soluci√≥n, que actualmente est√°n desplegando en empresas de Paraguay, genera:

  • Aceleraci√≥n de procesos de cierre contable
  • Descentralizaci√≥n de la carga (log√≠stica puede cargar facturas directamente)
  • Validaci√≥n del CDC en la p√°gina de la DNIT desde la transacci√≥n est√°ndar de SAP
  • Reducci√≥n del papeleo
  • Circuitos de aprobaci√≥n m√°s √°giles

Contabilidad Orientada a Unidades de Negocio: El Ferrari sin Usar
La segunda parte de la presentaci√≥n toc√≥ un punto cr√≠tico que Juan Jos√© identific√≥ en m√∫ltiples implementaciones:
"Cada vez que conozco un cliente nuevo, le pregunto: ¬øCu√°l es tu estado de resultados por marca? ¬øCu√°l es tu margen por marca? Y no lo sabe, o tiene que andar sacando muchos Excel."
El diagn√≥stico es claro: muchas empresas tienen el centro de beneficios mal armado. El centro de beneficios es el dato que consolida todo lo que corresponde al estado de resultados: gastos, ventas y costos directos.

La Propuesta: ROADMAP Analytics
Para resolver esto, la soluci√≥n presentada es Roadmap Analytics, construida sobre SAP Analytics Cloud en entorno S/4HANA:
Concepto Clave
Levanta toda la informaci√≥n del estado de resultados en la memoria de HANA y deriva las dimensiones a partir del documento contable. Es similar al antiguo m√≥dulo COPA (an√°lisis de rentabilidad), pero sin necesidad de crear tablas f√≠sicas nuevas.
Antes vs Ahora

Antes: Crear tablas f√≠sicas en el sistema con caracter√≠sticas e indicadores espec√≠ficos
Ahora: Derivaciones en memoria cuando se levanta el cubo de an√°lisis

Capacidades
An√°lisis Multidimensional: Estado de resultados por cliente, l√≠nea de negocio, sucursal, marca
Planificaci√≥n Consolidada: Integra planificaci√≥n de gastos por centro de costos con planificaci√≥n de ingresos y costos por centro de beneficios
Dashboards Ejecutivos: Desplegables en BTP con an√°lisis de plan vs real
Reportes Descargables: Estados de resultados en Excel con la informaci√≥n consolidada

El Caso Real: Transformaci√≥n en Horas
Juan Jos√© comparti√≥ un ejemplo reciente en Paraguay donde cambiaron la estructura de centros de beneficio de una empresa:
"Ahorramos horas de trabajo de cierre de mes para reportes b√°sicos como la rentabilidad de la empresa por unidad de negocio. No lo ten√≠a cubierto una empresa que tiene SAP hace m√°s de 10 a√±os."

El Mensaje de Fondo

"Muchas veces SAP te da una Ferrari, pero no la usan. Tienen la funcionalidad, pero no la est√°n aprovechando."

La presentaci√≥n dej√≥ en claro que no se trata solo de implementar SAP, sino de aprovechar sus capacidades reales. Ya sea automatizando el procesamiento de facturas electr√≥nicas para responder a los desaf√≠os regulatorios y de volumen, o configurando correctamente los centros de beneficio para tener visibilidad real del negocio.

Ambas soluciones est√°n pensadas para S/4HANA y representan la evoluci√≥n natural de funcionalidades que SAP ha tenido durante a√±os, pero que ahora, con la potencia de HANA y la integraci√≥n con BTP, pueden implementarse de manera m√°s √°gil y efectiva.

¬øTu empresa est√° aprovechando el potencial completo de su inversi√≥n en SAP?

Gracias a Juan Jos√© Torres por compartir su experiencia y conocimiento, y al equipo organizador del SAP Inside Track Paraguay por crear estos espacios de intercambio. #SITCDE2025

entry.title: Re: New to SAP in Accounts Payable ‚Äî What Should I Learn...
entry.content:
Good morning sir , 

First you can try to look at the "Company Code" view of the vendor mater data , try to understand how does the "Payment term" and "Reconciliation Account" work .  Then you can try to learn about how to do the payment process (t-code : F-53 or F-44 ) to clear AP line item , sometimes we also use "Automatic Payment" function (t-code: F110) you can check how to use these t-code from the internet . 

Next you should learn about General ledger , this is not too hard .

After you know the outline about all FI-AP , FI-GL , and maybe a little FI-AR , you can start to learn about the integration between MM module and FI module . First you can learn about the standard purchasing business flow in SAP , generally there are 3 steps : 1.Create Purchase Order --> 2.Goods Receipt --> 3.Invoice Receipt . Only step 2 and 3 will generate FI document , about this you can search on the internet there are many posts about this . After you know the standard flow in SAP , you can try to study how your company is doing it , see the FI document flow in your purchasing flow . There is an important concept : "GR/IR Account" , please also search it on the internet . 

After you understand your business flow , you can try to study the monthly closing process and yearly closing process for your accounting department .

maybe you can also learn about Material master data , how does it work in purchase order , and how does it influence FI module .

regards

Shi Zhekui

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025: Transformaci√≥n √Ågil - C√≥mo Acompa√±ar el Cambio en la Era de SAP
entry.content:
Del Control T√©cnico a la Transformaci√≥n √Ågil - C√≥mo Acompa√±ar el Cambio en la Era de SAP
El SAP Inside Track Paraguay SITCDE2025 cont√≥ con una presentaci√≥n reveladora de Esteban Hartzstein, Director y Fundador de Tebyon Consulting, quien con m√°s de 30 a√±os de experiencia trabajando con SAP, comparti√≥ una reflexi√≥n contundente: existe una enorme brecha entre lo que SAP desarrolla en Alemania y lo que realmente se implementa en Latinoam√©rica.


La Pregunta Inc√≥moda: ¬øSeguimos en 2008?
Reci√©n llegado del ALM Summit 2025 en Alemania, Esteban fue directo: "Hay una desconexi√≥n entre lo que pasa en los product managers que est√°n desarrollando los productos SAP y lo que se termina implementando en las empresas. Seguimos viendo implementaciones que parecen de los a√±os 90."
Los problemas recurrentes:

  • Se implementan como ERPs tradicionales, no se conocen los procesos est√°ndares
  • Demasiados gaps y desarrollos Z sin valor real
  • Falta de metodolog√≠a: "¬øCon Excel y PowerPoint alcanza? No alcanza"
  • Desconocimiento de herramientas como Signavio Process Navigator y Cloud ALM
  • Datos poco limpios, testing deficiente, cutovers problem√°ticos

SAP BTM y SAP ALM: Los Conceptos Clave
SAP Business Transformation Management (BTM) es el enfoque metodol√≥gico que combina cuatro ejes: Estrategia y Valores, Procesos y Arquitectura, Programas y Proyectos, y Personas y Culturas.
SAP Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) gestiona todo el ciclo de vida de las aplicaciones: Implementaci√≥n (Design, Build, Test, Deploy), Operaci√≥n (Detect, Analyze, Correct, Automate), Mejora Continua y Servicios.


La Toolchain Integrada: El Nuevo Paradigma
SAP ha evolucionado de un sistema monol√≠tico a una cadena de herramientas especializadas e integradas:

  • SAP LeanIX: Arquitectura empresarial
  • SAP Signavio: Gesti√≥n de procesos
  • SAP Cloud ALM: Implementaci√≥n y operaciones (el orquestador central)
  • WalkMe/EnableNow: Adopci√≥n digital

SAP Cloud ALM: Gratuito, Potente y Subutilizado
Esteban enfatiz√≥: "Todos los proyectos deber√≠an estar usando Cloud ALM. Es un producto gratuito entregado por SAP, se habilita rapidamente y est√° en la nube."
N√∫meros que impresionan:

  • 2020: 250 clientes
  • 2025: +10,000 clientes proyectados

Capacidades de implementaci√≥n:
Project & Task Management, Process Management, Documentation, Test Orchestration, Test Execution, Deployment Orchestration, Change Enablement.
Capacidades operativas:
Business Process Monitoring con KPIs predefinidos, Job & Automation Monitoring, Integration Monitoring, Health Monitoring, Real User Monitoring, Configuration & Security Analysis - todo con procesamiento inteligente mediante IA (Joule).

Clean Core: Los 5 Principios para Sistemas √Ågiles
SAP Clean Core garantiza que los sistemas se mantengan √°giles y rentables:

  1. Business Processes: Usar est√°ndares sin modificar el core
  2. Extensibility: Desacoplar extensiones (desarrollar en BTP)
  3. Data: Controlar datos seg√∫n √∫ltimos est√°ndares
  4. Integration: Mantener el landscape confiable y flexible
  5. Operations: Operaciones efectivas y eficientes

El Mensaje: Aprovechemos lo que SAP Ya nos Dio
Las recomendaciones finales de Esteban fueron claras:

  • Entiendan los procesos de negocio actuales antes de implementar
  • Planifiquen la arquitectura empresarial
  • Modelen procesos To-Be basados en est√°ndares SAP
  • Usen SAP Activate y trabajen con sprints
  • Aprovechen Cloud ALM gratuito para gesti√≥n de proyectos
  • Operen con monitoreo inteligente
  • Consulten a especialistas - no todas las consultoras tienen el conocimiento necesario

Reflexi√≥n Final
"Cloud ALM lo tienen todos gratuito. Signavio puede ser que tengan alguna versi√≥n incluida. Las herramientas est√°n disponibles, la metodolog√≠a est√° documentada."
La pregunta no es si SAP tiene las herramientas y metodolog√≠as - las tiene, est√°n documentadas y muchas son gratuitas. La pregunta es: ¬øestamos aprovechando todo lo que SAP ha preparado para nosotros, o seguimos implementando como en 2008?
El cambio de era en SAP no es solo tecnol√≥gico - es metodol√≥gico y cultural. Requiere que clientes, consultores y partners demos un paso adelante hacia la verdadera transformaci√≥n empresarial.

Gracias a Esteban Hartzstein y Tebyon Consulting  por compartir su experiencia del ALM Summit 2025 en Alemania, y al equipo organizador del SAP Inside Track Paraguay.

entry.title: Re: Enable Now ‚Äì Table of contents and audio integration...
entry.content:
Hi team Wibke,

It is not possible to create links to internal sections of a scrollable page.  Unfortunately, the HTML cleaner in Enable Now modifies the links, including internal links, and the modified version of the link does not work if the link is to another section of the same page.

It would be possible to play different audio as the user scrolls down the page, however, you will have to consider the best way to trigger that audio.  Using Enable Now, you can add multiple audio files to a single page and then trigger the relevant audio for the corresponding section.

 

 

 

The easiest way that I can think to trigger the audio is to get users to play it when they are ready.  You could easily do that by adding buttons to the page, at the relevant points, and setting up an action to play the relevant piece of audio when the user clicks the corresponding button.

 

 

 

Hope that helps.

Regards
Shane

entry.title: Introduction to API in SAP ABAP
entry.content:
Introduction to REST APIs in SAP ABAP ‚Äì A Beginner-Friendly Guide

In today‚Äôs digital landscape, integration is at the heart of every business process. Whether it‚Äôs connecting SAP with e-commerce platforms, CRMs, payment gateways, or cloud applications‚ÄîAPIs play a crucial role in making systems communicate smoothly and securely.

As SAP evolves, an ABAP developer is no longer limited to classical reports and enhancements.

We now work in a world where REST APIs, JSON payloads, and HTTP calls are becoming everyday essentials.

This blog marks Part 1 of my API Series for SAP Developers, where I break down core API concepts in simple words, along with how they relate to SAP ABAP.

What is an API? 

  • API stands for Application Programming Interface‚Äîa structured way for two systems to communicate.

Think of an API as a messenger that carries a request from one system and brings back a response from another.

For example:

  • SAP retrieving live weather details from a weather API
  • SAP sending order data to a third-party logistics system
  • SAP fetching exchange rates from an external service

Understanding REST and RESTful APIs

  • REST (Representational State Transfer) is an architectural style that defines how systems interact using simple, lightweight standards‚Äîusually over HTTP.

A REST API follows these REST principles and works on the basis of:

‚û°Ô∏è A Request sent by the client

‚û°Ô∏è A Response returned by the server

This makes REST APIs fast, scalable, and widely used.

Structure of an API Request

A typical API request consists of four key elements:

1. Endpoint

  • The URL where the request is sent.

Example: /weather/data/city=Berlin

2. Method (HTTP Verb)

  • Defines the action to perform.

Method Purpose:

  1. GET Retrieve data
  2. POST Create new data
  3. PUT Replace/update full data
  4. PATCH Update partial data
  5. DELETE Remove data

3. Headers

  • Used for authentication (API key, bearer token) and metadata (content type, encoding).

4. Body (Payload)

  • The actual data being sent‚Äîusually JSON or XML.

Example (JSON):

{

  "city": "Berlin",

  "unit": "celsius"

}

Prerequisites in SAP to Consume an API:

  • Before calling an API from SAP ABAP, ensure:
  • ‚úî SICF Service is Active
  • SAP uses ICF (Internet Communication Framework) for HTTP/HTTPS calls.
  • Transaction: SICF
  • ‚úî Required Authorizations
  • Your user should have permissions for:
  • Making HTTP calls
  • Accessing destinations
  • Using classes like CL_HTTP_CLIENT

How SAP ABAP Communicates with APIs:

API provides robust classes to make HTTP calls:

  • CL_HTTP_CLIENT ‚Äì Create and send requests
  • IF_HTTP_CLIENT ‚Äì Handle and process responses

With these, you can:

‚úî Send GET/POST/PUT/PATCH/DELETE calls

‚úî Send JSON/XML body

‚úî Read and parse JSON responses

‚úî Connect SAP to external cloud services

This opens doors to integrations like:

  •  Fetching weather data
  • Connecting to payment gateways
  • Sending delivery data to logistics providers
  • Communicating with AI/ML APIs

Example Use Cases for APIs in ABAP

Here are some real-world scenarios where ABAP developers use APIs:

1. Integrating SAP with a CRM

  • Send customer details to Salesforce or HubSpot using POST calls.

2. Fetching Live Data

  • Retrieve stock prices, exchange rates, or weather details in real time.

3. Automating External Processes

  • Send purchase order confirmations to vendor portals.

4. Connecting SAP to Cloud Applications

  • Use REST APIs to integrate SAP with cloud apps, chatbots, mobile apps, and dashboards.

Conclusion

  • In modern SAP landscapes, REST APIs are not just a concept‚Äîthey are a necessity.

As an ABAP developer, understanding APIs empowers you to:

  • Build smarter integrations
  • Automate cross-platform workflows
  • Connect SAP with the outside world
  • Stay aligned with SAP‚Äôs shift toward cloud and digital transformation
  • This blog sets the foundation.

Stay tuned for Part 2 of the API series!

Your feedback and suggestions are always welcome. üòä

entry.title: Performance Optimization Strategies for Marketplace App Scenarios in SAP Commerce Cloud
entry.content:
I‚Äôm looking to gather insights and best practices on improving performance for marketplace-based applications built on SAP Commerce Cloud. Marketplace setups often introduce additional complexity‚Äîmultiple sellers, high product volumes, heavy API usage, and dynamic pricing or inventory updates‚Äîwhich can significantly impact site speed and scalability.
In addition to SAP Commerce Cloud‚Äôs built-in tuning options, I‚Äôm also interested in how teams are leveraging Cloudflare to enhance overall performance, security, and stability.
Specifically, I‚Äôd like to hear about:

  • Proven performance optimization techniques for large-scale marketplace apps in SAP Commerce Cloud
  • Managing high traffic, seller onboarding, and large catalog structures efficiently
  • Cache strategies (platform-level, CDN-level, and Cloudflare-specific optimizations like caching rules, Workers, and edge functions)
  • How Cloudflare has helped reduce load, improve response times, or mitigate spikes in traffic
  • Handling API-heavy marketplace interactions with minimal latency
  • Any performance pitfalls you‚Äôve encountered and how you addressed them


If you‚Äôve tuned a marketplace system, integrated Cloudflare, or built performance monitoring pipelines, your experiences would be incredibly valuable.
